title: SAPD: Teen shot in the face near Churchill High School by unknown suspect
content:
SAN ANTONIO — A 17-year-old man was shot in the face by an unknown suspect Tuesday night on the North Side near Winston Churchill High School, according to police.
Emergency personnel responded shortly after 10:10 p.m. Tuesday to a Baptist Healthcare Clinic for a man who suffered a gunshot wound to the face.
RELATED: San Antonio child, 1, suffers life-threatening injuries in 'egregious' sexual assault
The shooting reportedly occurred in the 1100 block of Patricia Drive, near the Tuscany Park Apartments. The address is about one block from Winston Churchill High School.
The man was walking to the store when an unknown person in a white BMW fired a single shot, hitting the man in the face, according to a preliminary police report.
The victim, who was unable to provide any more details, was transported to University Hospital from the clinic and was taken to ICU, the report said.
Text "Breaking" to 48421 for breaking news alerts from mySA.com
